And most of them showed that they had this very thing in the mandates from their own churches, and also from the States themselves of their own provinces. This disa- greement of counsels and judgments threw in a new de- lay to the national Synod 3 for they who had hitherto re- sisted its convocation, eagerly seizing on this occasion, laboured earnestly by all means, that the convocation of the Synod, though now promised, might be hindered.
